# Courses  

```{python}
import pandas as pd

# Course data
courses = {
    "Course Name": [
        "Cloud Analytics for Business",
        "Project Management",
        "Financial Concepts",
        "Enterprise Risk Management",
        "Quantitative and Qualitative Decision Making",
        "Business Analytics Foundations"
    ],
    "Course Status": [
        "Current",
        "Completed",
        "Completed",
        "Completed",
        "Completed",
        "Completed"
    ]
}

# Create DataFrame
df = pd.DataFrame(courses)

# Style DataFrame
df_styled = (df.style
   .set_table_styles([
       {'selector': 'th', 'props': [('text-align', 'center'), ('color', 'black')]},
       {'selector': 'td', 'props': [('text-align', 'center'), ('color', 'black')]}
   ])
   .set_properties(**{'background-color': '#D6E1F0', 'font-family': 'Arial, sans-serif'})
   .hide(axis="index")  # <-- Add this line
)

df_styled  # <-- This must be the last line for Quarto to display the styled table
```
